greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The smallest prime with digit sum n and maximum digit product (or 0 if no such prime exists).
comment: Conjecture: If n > 4 and a(n) > 0, then a(n) consists only of the digits 2, 3 and 4. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Dec 17 2015
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..2001
results.author: _Lekraj Beedassy_, Mar 10 2008
